parameters.Name: service_code
parameters.Description: the service_code for which you are making a request

parameters.Name: jurisdiction_id
parameters.Description: only required if the endpoint serves multiple jurisdictions

parameters.Name: lat
parameters.Description: longitude using the (WGS84) projection

parameters.Name: long
parameters.Description: longitude using the (WGS84) projection

parameters.Name: address_string
parameters.Description: Human entered address or description of location. This should be written from most specific to most general geographic unit, eg address number or cross streets, street name, neighborhood/district, city/town/village, county, postal code. This is required if no lat/lon is provided.

parameters.Name: address_id
parameters.Description: The internal address ID used by a jurisdictions master address repository or other addressing system. Only required if no lat/long or address_string is provided.

parameters.Name: email
parameters.Description: The email address of the person submitting the request.

parameters.Name: device_id
parameters.Description: The unique device ID of the device submitting the request. This is usually only used for mobile devices. For example, Android devices use TelephonyManager.getDeviceId() and iPhone's use [UIDevice currentDevice].uniqueIdentifier.

parameters.Name: account_id
parameters.Description: The unique ID for the user account of the person submitting the request

parameters.Name: first_name
parameters.Description: The given name of the person submitting the request

parameters.Name: last_name
parameters.Description: The family name of the person submitting the request

parameters.Name: phone
parameters.Description: The phone number of the person submitting the request

parameters.Name: description
parameters.Description: A full description of the request or report being submitted. This may contain line breaks, but not html or code. Otherwise, this is free form text limited to 4,000 characters.

parameters.Name: media_url
parameters.Description: A URL to media associated with the request, eg an image. A convention for parsing media from this URL has yet to be established, so currently it will be done on a case by case basis. For example, if a jurisdiction accepts photos submitted via Twitpic.com, then clients can parse the page at the Twitpic URL for the image given the conventions of Twitpic.com. This could also be a URL to a media RSS feed where the clients can parse for media in a more structured way.

methods.Synopsis: Query the current status of multiple requests

parameters.Name: jurisdiction_id
parameters.Description: only required if the endpoint serves multiple jurisdictions

parameters.Name: service_code
parameters.Description: Specify the service type by calling the unique ID of the service_code. This defaults to all service codes when not declared; can be declared multiple times, comma delimited

parameters.Name: start_date
parameters.Description: Earliest datetime to include in search. When provided with end_date, allows one to search for requests which have a requested_datetime that matches a given range, but may not span more than 90 days. When not specified, the range defaults to most recent 90 days. Must use w3 format, eg 2010-01-01T00:00:00Z.

parameters.Name: end_date
parameters.Description: Latest datetime to include in search. When provided with start_date, allows one to search for requests which have a requested_datetime that matches a given range, but may not span more than 90 days. When not specified, the range defaults to most recent 90 days. Must use w3 format, eg 2010-01-01T00:00:00Z.

parameters.Name: status
parameters.Description: Allows one to search for requests which have a specific status. This defaults to all statuses; can be declared multiple times, comma delimited. E.g. "open" or "closed"
